title: EY partner jumps ship to Mills Oakley
text:
An EY partner has jumped ship to head up a new digital law practice started by Mills Oakley.

An EY partner has jumped ship to national law firm Mills Oakley. Shutterstock

Alec Christie, who was also a partner at DLA Piper for a decade, will start at Mills Oakley's newly created Digital Law practice on Monday.

In his time at EY, Christie helped develop the firm's Australian and Asia-Pacific Digital Law and Data Privacy team. His last job title at EY was Asia Pacific Digital Law Leader.

Mills Oakley told Street Talk the creation of the new practice that Christie will lead was in response to increased demand for digital and IT legal advice.

It's the second hire the firm has made in this space in the last month. Mills Oakley poached block chain and crypto expert Joni Pirovich from Hall & Wilcox just last week.
description: Former EY partner Alec Christie will start at Mills Oakley's newly created Digital Law practice on Monday.
